title: JavaScript Conditionals
description: Understanding if/else statements, switch cases, and logical operators

questions.question: What will be the output of: console.log(5 > 3 && 2 < 4);
questions.explanation: Both conditions are true (5 > 3 is true and 2 < 4 is true), so the AND operator returns true.

questions.question: Which operator is used for strict equality?
questions.explanation: === is the strict equality operator that compares both value and type.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'else if' statement?
options: To check multiple conditions in sequence
questions.explanation: else if allows checking multiple conditions in sequence when the previous conditions are false.
